title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Language Learning Optimization Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic proficiency in digital device usage and intermediate-level language learning experience
context.additional_context: Learning modules (5–10 minutes) accessible via smartphones support job-integrated learning for professionals.

learning_goals: Learners can decompose complex linguistic concepts into three-tiered hierarchical visual aids (graphic organizers) and explain them with over 85% accuracy.
Learners can apply 20 specialized terminology items contextually using 3-minute microlearning content designed with cognitive load considerations.
Learners can submit a language pattern analysis project with 90% completion by incorporating peer feedback from a collaborative learning platform.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
